oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1956-09-29 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from September 29, 1956. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Hank Snow (host/performer), guest performer Hawkshaw Hawkins, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Lew Childre, Del Wood, Minnie Pearl, and Chet Atkins. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Snow; Jordanaires; Hawkshaw Hawkins; Lew Childre; Del Wood
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Hank Snow -- I Don't Hurt Anymore (Hank Snow) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces the Jordanaires -- When I Move (Jordanaires) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces Hawkshaw Hawkins -- Sunny Side Of The Mountain (Hawkshaw Hawkins) -- Hank Snow introduces Lew Childre -- Mississippi Sawyer (Lew Childre calls) -- Hank Snow talks -- Farther Along (Hank Snow, Jordanaires) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Hank Snow) -- Prince Albert jingle -- Hank Snow introduces Del Wood -- Are You From Dixie (Del Wood) [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Minnie Pearl; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Jordanaires (Musical group); Childre, Lew, 1901-1961; Snow, Hank; Hawkins, Hawkshaw, 1921-1963
